title: Amazon Settles for $2.5B Over Prime Subscription Deception Claims
snippets: Federal regulators say Amazon has agreed to pay a historic sum to resolve their allegations that its web designs manipulated millions of people into paying for Prime subscriptions, which were also purposefully hard to cancel. Affected shoppers are slated to receive payouts.
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit
Opening arguments for the trial in Seattle took place on Tuesday and the proceedings were expected to last a month.
The lawsuit accused Amazon of deceiving users into signing up for its Prime service and making it difficult to cancel it.
The FTC's lawsuit stemmed from previous Business Insider reporting that found Amazon was aware users found the Prime cancellation process confusing.
Business Insider investigated Amazon Prime's practices in 2022, reigniting an FTC case

The company will be required to pay a $1 billion civil penalty and provide $1.5 billion in refunds back to an estimated 35 million consumers harmed by the company's "deceptive Prime enrollment practices," the FTC says.
The FTC said Amazon used “dark patterns” to trick consumers into auto-renewals, then created a complex cancellation process internally dubbed “Iliad” after the Trojan War.
titles: Amazon to pay $2.5 billion to settle U.S. lawsuit that it 'tricked' people into Prime
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit - Axios
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement with FTC over 'deceptive' Prime program
Amazon Reaches Record $2.5 Billion Settlement With FTC Over ‘Deceptive’ Prime Tactics
Amazon to pay $2.5 billion settlement over allegations it deceived Prime subscribers
How Business Insider's investigation into Amazon Prime led to a record $2.5 billion settlement with the US government
Amazon to pay $2.5B in FTC settlement over ‘deceptive’ Prime tactics
Amazon to pay $2.5 billion, one of the largest FTC settlements in history, to mitigate claims it tricked millions of people into signing up for Prime
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $2.5 billion settlement with federal regulators over allegations of deceptive web designs that tricked millions into unwanted Prime subscriptions and made cancellation difficult. The settlement includes a $1 billion civil penalty and $1.5 billion in consumer refunds for the estimated 35 million affected. The FTC accused Amazon of using "dark patterns" for auto-renewals and a complex cancellation process. This resolution follows a lawsuit and a Business Insider investigation into Amazon Prime's practices.

title: Starbucks Unveils $1B Restructuring, to Close 1% of Stores, Lay Off 900
snippets: The coffee giant plans to cut 900 corporate jobs and shut down about 1% of its stores as the chain's turnaround plan approaches a one-year mark.
The coffee chain is restructuring to save money by closing its worst performing stores.
The cuts are expected to lead to hundreds of layoffs.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifkFVX3lxTE1WeUNnZ0xCQ3d2cGI5Zk5HbTI3VlhfWlFfMndWVmpDUWp5dTBfT25sNDI1TlVpSnlNclh0ZkdkZEdqU09teC1ad3NGVjBSVHI0TWdIbDhEVlozVnA2a3hYQU00c1F1RGlUbWpLVWFmeXJSZU9fdnhBYzM3XzBwdw?oc=5" target="_blank">Starbucks to close stores, cut 900 jobs in $1B restructur
Starbucks announced a $1 billion restructuring plan Thursday that involves closing some of its North American coffeehouses and laying off about 900 workers.
titles: Starbucks is closing more stores and laying off 900 workers
Starbucks to close some US and UK stores
Starbucks to close underperforming stores in restructuring efforts
Starbucks to close stores, cut 900 jobs in $1B restructuring - Axios
Starbucks to close stores, lay off workers in $1 billion restructuring plan
summary: Starbucks announced a $1 billion restructuring plan, which includes closing 1% of its North American corporately owned stores and laying off 900 non-retail staff. This move is part of a turnaround strategy led by new CEO Brian Niccol.

title: Microsoft Fires Workers Protesting Cloud Service Use by Israeli Military
snippets: The decision comes after Microsoft fired employees for participating in protests over the use of its cloud services by the Israeli military.
Software giant’s move follows investigation into use of its products to surveil Palestinian civilians
Microsoft said it found that Israel was violating some terms of service for its products and that it does “not provide technology to facilitate mass surveillance of civilians.”

The investigation was sparked by a story in The Guardian that reported that Unit 8200, the elite Israel military intelligence unit, was using Azure cloud storage to house data on phone calls obtained through the surveillance of Palestinians in Gaza and the West Bank.
titles: Microsoft cuts off cloud services to Israeli military unit after report of storing Palestinians' phone calls
Microsoft cuts off some services to the Israeli military
Microsoft Disables Some Services to Israel’s Defense Ministry
Microsoft cuts cloud services to Israeli military unit over Palestinian surveillance
summary: Microsoft terminated employees who protested against the company's cloud services being used by the Israeli military. This action followed an investigation revealing Israel's misuse of Microsoft products to surveil Palestinian civilians, violating service terms. Microsoft stated it does not support technology for mass civilian surveillance. The probe was initiated by a report on Israel's military intelligence unit using Azure cloud for storing surveilled Palestinian phone data.

title: Ex-Arsenal Youth Player Billy Vigar Dies After Game Injury at 21
snippets: Chichester City FC confirmed that Billy Vigar, 21, died on Thursday morning.

• Vigar, 21, sustained injury in league game on Saturday

  • Arsenal pay tribute to ‘fiercely determined’ forward

The Chichester City forward Billy Vigar has died at the age of 21 after sustaining a “significant brain injury” in a game last Saturday. The former Ar
Former Arsenal striker Billy Vigar has died aged 21 after suffering a 'significant brain injury' while playing for Chichester City.
Former Arsenal youth player Billy Vigar has died after sustaining a “significant brain injury” during a lower-league soccer match in England. He was 21.
titles: Former Arsenal striker dies after sustaining 'significant injury' during game
Billy Vigar, Chichester and former Arsenal player, dies after sustaining brain injury
Ex-Arsenal striker Vigar dies aged 21 after suffering 'significant brain injury'
Former Arsenal youth player Billy Vigar dies after sustaining brain injury
summary: Billy Vigar, a 21-year-old former Arsenal youth player and Chichester City FC forward, passed away after suffering a significant brain injury during a league game last Saturday. His death was confirmed on Thursday morning. Arsenal paid tribute to him, highlighting his determination.

title: Sarkozy Convicted of Taking Gaddafi Funds, Sentenced to 5 Years
snippets: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.
Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has been jailed for 5 years after being found guilty of criminal conspiracy.
Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was convicted and sentenced to five years in prison on some charges in a case tied to the late Libyan dictator Moammar Gadhafi.
Nicolas Sarkozy, convicted of conspiracy for seeking 2007 campaign funds from then-Libyan dictator Moammar Gaddafi, would be the first modern French president to serve time.
titles: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
Ex-French president Sarkozy gets 5-year jail term
Paris court convicts former French President Sarkozy of criminal conspiracy in Libya trial
Former French president handed 5-year prison term over Gaddafi money
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy, the former French president, was convicted by a Paris criminal court of criminal conspiracy for accepting millions of euros in campaign funds from the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi. He was sentenced to five years in prison and will remain in custody even if he appeals. Sarkozy has consistently denied the charges.

title: Dallas Stars' Jamie Benn Out 4 Weeks After Lung Surgery
snippets: Stars captain and left winger Jamie Benn will miss at least four weeks after having surgery on a collapsed lung, the team announced Thursday.

Stars captain Jamie Benn to undergo surgery for collapsed lung
summary: Dallas Stars captain and left winger Jamie Benn will be sidelined for at least four weeks following surgery for a collapsed lung, as announced by the team. This means Benn will miss the start of the season.

title: Team Europe to Defend Ryder Cup Against USA at Bethpage Black
snippets: With the past five Ryder Cups won so convincingly on home soil, will Bethpage be any different as the US look to win back the trophy that Europe regained in Rome?
With the past five Ryder Cups won so convincingly on home soil, will Bethpage be any different as the US look to win back the trophy that Europe regained in Rome?
Luke Donald’s Team Europe travel to Bethpage Black to defend the cup against a formidable Team USA after a stunning victory in Rome last time out
Here are the pairings and starting times for Friday morning foursomes at the 2025 Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black.
Latest scores, results, pairings and tee times for the 45th Ryder Cup, as Team USA host Team Europe at Bethpage Black.
titles: Where Ryder Cup battle will be won and lost
Where Ryder Cup battle will be won and lost
When will Ryder Cup pairings be announced for Friday foursomes?
Ryder Cup 2025 pairings, starting times: Friday morning foursomes
Latest Ryder Cup scores, results, pairings and tee times
summary: Team Europe, led by Luke Donald, is set to defend the Ryder Cup against Team USA at Bethpage Black, following their victory in Rome. The event marks the 45th Ryder Cup, with the past five editions won by the host team. The competition includes pairings and starting times for Friday morning foursomes.

title: Trump Admin Partners with Musk's AI for Gov Operations
snippets: Trump admin to use Elon Musk's Grok chatbot for government business&n
The AI company will charge government agencies just $0.42 for 18 months of “Grok for Government.”
xAI has reached a deal with the U.S. GSA to sell Grok to federal agencies for 42 cents over 18 months, undercutting OpenAI and Anthropic.
titles: Trump admin to use Elon Musk's Grok chatbot for government business - Axios
xAI’s Grok Chatbot Scores Government Deal Days After Trump And Musk Meeting
Elon Musk’s xAI offers Grok to federal government for 42 cents
summary: The Trump administration plans to utilize Elon Musk's AI company's Grok chatbot for government operations, securing a deal through the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA). This agreement allows federal agencies to access "Grok for Government" at a cost of $0.42 for an 18-month period, offering a competitive price point against rivals like OpenAI and Anthropic.

title: DeepMind AI Boosts Robot Reasoning, Opens Internet Access
snippets: New technology advances reasoning capabilities in general-purpose machines in push to make them more useful

Google DeepMind says its upgraded AI models enable robots to complete more complex tasks — and even tap into the web for help. During a press briefing, Google DeepMind’s head of robotics, Carolina Parada, told reporters that the company’s new AI models work in tandem to allow robots to “think m
DeepMind researchers believe this is the dawn of agentic robots.
titles: Google DeepMind unveils new robotics AI model that can sort laundry
Google DeepMind’s new AI models can search the web to help robots complete tasks
Google DeepMind unveils its first “thinking” robotics AI
summary: Google DeepMind has developed new AI models that enhance the reasoning capabilities of robots, enabling them to perform complex tasks and access the internet for assistance. According to Carolina Parada, head of robotics at Google DeepMind, these advancements mark a significant step towards creating more useful, general-purpose machines. DeepMind researchers view this development as the beginning of the era for agentic robots.

title: UK PM Plans Stricter Measures on Irregular Migrants to Curb Illegal Work
snippets: The prime minister believes a new scheme would help crack down on illegal working in the UK.
Plans to toughen measures against irregular migrants come despite concerns over civil liberties

As government looks for ways to tackle illegal immigration, move will spark battle with civil liberties campaigners

All working adults will need digital ID cards under plans to be announced by Keir Starmer in a move that will spark a battle with civil liberties campaigners.

The
titles: Digital ID to be compulsory for all UK adults under government plans
Starmer set to announce digital ID cards for all UK adults
Keir Starmer to announce plans for digital ID cards
summary: The UK Prime Minister is considering a new scheme aimed at reducing illegal working by introducing stricter measures against irregular migrants. This proposal, which has raised concerns regarding civil liberties, could be officially announced by Friday as part of the government's efforts to address illegal immigration in the UK.

title: White House Warns of Mass Firings if Government Shuts Down
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxOOHRLQVNEeFVseWFQR1ZBT2pqN21IZ0laeFd4bmE3aXBUQkdUaXZjWGVxRWNtd2FPUk5XLVEyTXNpbG45cXdZZEdodTN6M2R4a1RQVlFkR19DMXZXNkJvMlprbXo3b1ZSbENqSDJLdmNqeDBEVzdfTmYxb1c3SUFMb0FEWQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Why Democrats aren't sweating Republican threats

The warning could ratchet up pressure on Congress to strike a deal to avert a government shutdown.
The Trump administration is signaling that a government shutdown on Wednesday could lead to more firings. Democrats say its an intimidation tactic.
titles: Why Democrats aren't sweating Republican threats of mass firings in a shutdown - Axios
White House threatens mass firings if government shuts down - Axios
Trump OMB orders preparation for mass firings of federal workers if government shuts down

summary: The White House has warned of mass firings in the event of a government shutdown, pressuring Congress to reach a deal. This move, criticized by Democrats as an intimidation tactic, marks a more aggressive approach than previous shutdowns.

snippets: What key battles do England need to win in order to beat Canada and lift the Women's Rugby World Cup at Twickenham on Saturday?

• Maple Leafs unchanged for Twickenham showdown

  • ‘We will give everything, we believe we can go all way’

Canada will seek to “burst” England’s aura of invincibility in the Rugby World Cup final, says their most-capped player, Tyson Beukeboom.

Canada will
No. 2 Canada and No. 1 England have named unchanged lineups for Saturday’s heavyweight clash in the final of the Women’s Rugby World Cup.

Confident Canada aim to ‘burst’ England aura in Women’s Rugby World Cup final
Canada, England name unchanged lineups for heavyweight clash in Rugby World Cup final

title: Trump Declares Ukraine Can Reclaim Territory with EU Support
snippets: US President Trump has declared that, with the EU's support, Ukraine is in a position to win back its territory currently occupied by Russia. What do Ukrainian politicians and experts make of this about-face?
President Trump has shown dwindling interest in mediating a peace accord, joining European “security guarantees” for Ukraine or providing aid and intelligence to the Ukrainians.
titles: What does Ukraine make of Trump saying it can win the war?
With His Pivot on Ukraine, Trump May Be Washing His Hands of the War
summary: US President Trump has declared that Ukraine can reclaim its territory occupied by Russia with EU support, marking a significant policy shift. Despite this, Trump has shown less interest in mediating a peace deal, joining European security efforts, or offering aid and intelligence to Ukraine. The reaction from Ukrainian politicians and experts to this change has not been specified.

title: Florida Panthers' Barkov Injured in Training, Awaits Condition Update
snippets: Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov needed to be helped off the ice after appearing to sustain an injury to his right leg during the first full training camp practice of the season.
The Florida Panthers are awaiting word on the status of captain Aleksander Barkov
titles: Panthers' Barkov helped off ice after injuring leg
Panthers captain Barkov helped off ice with leg injury
summary: During the first full training camp practice of the season, Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov sustained an apparent injury to his right leg and required assistance to leave the ice. The team is currently awaiting further updates on his condition.

title: Shooting at Dallas ICE Facility Leaves One Dead, Two Injured
snippets: The ICE facility in Dallas where three detainees were killed in a shooting on Wednesday is still closed, but many people with scheduled check-ins still showed up the next day, only to be turned away.
A gunman fired at an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Dallas, killing one person and injuring two others. Investigators provide updates on the shooting and the gunman.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiekFVX3lxTE54X1N4YjVLWDZFT3AtdW43eWlfY1Y2dHR3Q2trUk02S0t5TE1NYjB3VC1UdFJOTVBXRzU3MF9raUJqNC13WEszQ2R6NkhXX3daM0NZM3hnQS1laTI0ODA4aGFVU185clZ3Y0toOFBtSUc0Ymp6RXgwT3hB?oc=5" target="_blank">1 detainee killed, 2 injured in shooting at Dallas ICE facility
titles: 24 hours after shooting, migrants show up to ICE Dallas facility fearful of missing their appointments
What we know about the Dallas ICE facility shooting
1 detainee killed, 2 injured in shooting at Dallas ICE facility - Axios
summary: A shooting at an ICE facility in Dallas resulted in one detainee being killed and two others injured. Following the incident, the facility was closed, yet many individuals with scheduled check-ins arrived the next day and were turned away. Investigations into the shooting and the gunman are ongoing.

title: Spain, Italy Send Navy Ships to Aid Gaza Flotilla Amid Israeli Drone Reports
snippets: Spanish, Italian decisions to send ships to assist Gaza flotilla sign of increased pro-Palestinian sentiment in Europe.

Spain is joining Italy in sending a navy ship to help an aid flotilla bound for Gaza, after activists said they were targeted by Israeli drones. Israel accuses them of being complicit with Hamas. DW has more.
titles: Why have Spain and Italy sent ships to assist the Gaza Sumud flotilla?
Middle East updates: Spain sends navy ship to Gaza flotilla
summary: Spain and Italy are dispatching navy ships to support an aid flotilla heading to Gaza, following reports of the flotilla being targeted by Israeli drones. This move indicates a growing pro-Palestinian sentiment in Europe. Israel has accused the activists involved with the flotilla of complicity with Hamas, as reported by DW.

title: Trump Seeks Supreme Court Help to Fire Fed's Cook Amid Fraud Claims
snippets: President Trump has asked the Supreme Court to lift a lower court order blocking him from removing Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors.
President Donald Trump has said he wants to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook because of allegations she committed mortgage fraud. She denies any wrongdoing.
Top officials from across political spectrum warn president’s move would jeopardise central bank’s independence
titles: Trump would 'eviscerate' Fed independence with Lisa Cook firing, lawyers tell Supreme Court
Former Fed, Treasury chiefs urge Supreme Court to block Trump firing Lisa Cook
Ex-Fed chiefs urge Supreme Court to deny Trump’s bid to remove Cook
summary: President Trump has requested the Supreme Court to remove a lower court's block on his attempt to fire Federal Reserve Board of Governors member Lisa Cook, citing allegations of mortgage fraud, which Cook denies. This move has prompted warnings from officials across the political spectrum about potential threats to the central bank's independence.

title: UEFA Considers Suspending Israel Federation Amid Gaza Conflict
snippets: European soccer body UEFA is moving toward a vote to suspend its member federation Israel over the war in Gaza, people familiar with the proposal told The Associated Press on Thursday.
European soccer body UEFA is moving toward a vote to suspend its member federation Israel over the war in Gaza, people familiar with the proposal told The Associated Press on Thursday.
titles: Report: UEFA expected to vote to suspend Israel
European soccer body UEFA moves toward vote to suspend Israel
summary: European soccer body UEFA is moving toward a vote to suspend its member federation Israel over the war in Gaza, people familiar with the proposal told The Associated Press on Thursday.

title: Pakistan Beats Bangladesh, Reaches Asia Cup Final Against India
snippets: Bangladesh crumble as Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf take three wickets each in Super Fours match in Dubai.

Pacers Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf shared six wickets as Pakistan beat Bangladesh by 11 runs Thursday to set up an Asia Cup final against archrival India.  Chasing 136, Bangladesh was restricted to 124-9 as Afridi took 3-17 while Rauf took 3-33, both in four overs.
titles: Pakistan beat Bangladesh by 11 runs to meet India in Asia Cup 2025 final
Pakistan beats Bangladesh by 11 runs to set up Asia Cup final against archrival India
summary: In the Asia Cup Super Fours match in Dubai, Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by 11 runs, with pacers Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf taking three wickets each, restricting Bangladesh to 124-9 in pursuit of 136. This victory secures Pakistan a spot in the final against India.

title: Democrats Demand Obamacare Subsidies in Funding Bill to Avoid Shutdown
snippets: Democrats demand that any stopgap funding measure to keep the federal government open include an extension of the enhanced Obamacare subsidies credits.
Obamacare enrollees face a "double whammy" in cost increases next year due to tax credits expiring along with planned premium increases from insurers.
titles: Health providers could lose $32 billion if ACA credits at center of shutdown fight expire
Hospitals To Lose $32 Billion If Congress Doesn’t Extend ACA Tax Credits, Study Warns
summary: Democrats are insisting that a temporary funding bill to prevent a federal government shutdown must also extend enhanced Obamacare subsidies. Without these subsidies, Obamacare enrollees will experience significant cost increases next year, stemming from both the expiration of tax credits and scheduled premium hikes by insurers.

title: Trump Suggests Lifting Sanctions, F-35 Sale to Turkey for Halting Russian Oil Bu
snippets: The US president suggests the US could lift sanctions on Turkey and allow it to buy F-35 jets.
Donald Trump told President Erdogan he might let Turkey buy US fighter jets if Ankara halts Russian oil purchases over the war in Ukraine.
titles: Trump urges Turkey to stop buying Russian oil as Erdogan chases deal on F-35s
Trump urges Turkey's Erdogan to stop buying Russian oil
summary: US President Donald Trump indicated the possibility of lifting sanctions on Turkey and permitting the purchase of F-35 jets if Ankara ceases buying Russian oil, amid the conflict in Ukraine.

title: ICE Facilities on High Alert After Dallas Shooting; Political Tensions Rise
snippets: Acting Immigration and Customs Enforcement Director Todd Lyons said he would put all ICE facilities on a higher alert following a shooting at a Dallas field office.

Officials said shooter used Ice tracking apps to monitor agents’ movements; Trump blames rise in political violence on ‘radical left … not the right’

Dozens of House Democrats have signed a letter to
titles: 'Tragic irony': Dallas ICE shooter was targeting agents, not detainees
Officials say Dallas immigration facility shooter ‘intended to kill Ice agents’ but was not part of ‘any specific group’ – live
summary: Following a shooting at a Dallas ICE field office, Acting Director Todd Lyons announced all ICE facilities will be on heightened alert. The shooter reportedly used ICE tracking apps to monitor agents. In response to a rise in political violence, President Trump attributed the cause to the 'radical left,' not the right. Additionally, dozens of House Democrats have called for increased security measures in a signed letter.

title: Israeli Strikes on Sanaa Kill Dozens After Houthi Drone Attack
snippets: Israel claims 'powerful' Sanaa strikes hit Houthi command sites, killing dozens.
The Israeli military said it was targeting sites linked to the Houthi militia, but a witness said a residential building was hit. A day earlier, a Houthi drone hit the Israeli city of Eilat.
titles: Israeli strikes pound Yemen’s capital as Houthi leader decries Gaza war
Israel Attacks Yemeni Capital, a Day After Houthi Drone Strike
summary: The Israeli military conducted strikes in Sanaa, targeting Houthi command sites and reportedly killing dozens. This action was in response to a Houthi drone attack on Eilat, Israel. While Israel claims to have hit military targets, there are reports of a residential building being struck.

title: SportsLine Simulates 2025 Ryder Cup; Highlights Top Longshot Picks

titles: 2025 Ryder Cup longshot picks, Team USA vs. Team Europe odds, prediction, bets: Model backing Rory McIlroy
How Rory McIlroy became cornerstone of Team Europe at Ryder Cup
summary: SportsLine simulated the 2025 Ryder Cup 10,000 times, identifying top longshot picks for Team USA vs. Team Europe. A player who previously downplayed the Ryder Cup's importance, now the only European with a career Grand Slam, has become its most vocal supporter.

title: Cybercriminals Hack Kido Nursery, Demand Ransom for Data on 8,000 Children
snippets: Experts have condemned the hack as an "absolute new low" for cyber-crime.

Firm, which has 18 sites around London and more in US, India and China, has received ransom demand, say reports

The names, pictures and addresses of about 8,000 children have reportedly been stolen from the Kido nursery chain by a gang of cybercriminals.

The criminals have demanded a
titles: Names, pictures and addresses of 8,000 children stolen in nursery chain hack
Hackers reportedly steal details of 8,000 children from Kido nursery chain
summary: Cybercriminals targeted the Kido nursery chain, stealing names, pictures, and addresses of approximately 8,000 children from its databases across 18 London sites and additional locations in the US, India, and China. Experts have labeled this incident as an "absolute new low" in cyber-crime. The hackers have issued a ransom demand to the firm, according to reports.

title: Apple Blames EU's Digital Markets Act for Feature Delays
snippets: Apple is blaming the EU's enforcement of the DMA for delaying the launch of some features in the EU, saying the rules are "leading to a worse experience" for Apple customers in the bloc by exposing them to new risks and reducing choices.
"DMA compliance is not optional, it's an obligation," the EU reminds Apple.
titles: Apple blames EU’s Digital Markets Act for feature delays
Apple demands EU repeal the Digital Markets Act
summary: Apple has attributed delays in launching certain features in the EU to the enforcement of the Digital Markets Act (DMA), claiming it degrades customer experience by increasing risks and limiting choices. The EU has responded by emphasizing that compliance with the DMA is mandatory, not optional.
